H0.text: One is the number of protons that most hydrogen atoms have.

H1.text: Two is the number of protons that most hydrogen atoms have.

H2.text: Three is the number of protons in most hydrogen atoms.

H3.text: Four protons are the number of protons that most hydrogen atoms have.

A4.text: 1H is the most common isotope of hydrogen, with an abundance of >99.98%.

A5.text: Hydrogen has three naturally-occurring isotopes, denoted 1H, 2H and 3H.
